conops.path: /Users/arpithaprakash/Capstone/1-2CR CONOPS&DRAWs - Copy/New folder (33) - Copy/EIB and Night M4 CONOP.pptx

sections.MISSION:
Bull Troop conducts M4 night fire training at Range 124/126 NLT 062000JUL2022 IOT improve overall lethality in low visibility.
Leader’s
sections.PURPOSE: of this event is to allow Soldiers to become more familiarized with using PEQ-15 and PAS-13 while under low visibility.
sections.EXECUTION:
}:
PMI of M4 loading, unloading, reflective fire and movement fire.
Validation of all Soldiers weapon proficiency prior to movement to the firing line
Clearing of all Weapons
sections.END STATE:
/Training Outcomes:
All Soldiers are safely familiarized with acquiring and engaging targets under low visibility. Concept of the Operation: After day table 6 qualification 2nd PLT assumes the range and begins safety brief for the night. Soldiers receive a class on reflexive and movement fire and proper procedures to zero their PEQ-15 and PAS-13. Soldiers will perform a dry reflexive fire iteration prior to live fire
Soldiers will then receive 40 rounds of ammo to perform reflexive and movement fire engaging reflective targets at night.
Soldiers will validate proper use of lasers and then begin target engagements on command.
Soldiers will then move to range 126 to conduct a night time qualification on type E targets marked with illumination tape.
Safety: All Soldiers will properly demonstrate proficiency with a dry-fire engagement.
1x lane safety will be present for each 2x Soldiers
Resourcing
Troops to Task/ Bull Resources
OIC, RSO
Ammo NCO, 2x PAX
5x range safeties
2x gate guards
Ammo: 10,000
Land: Range 123
Trans: B TRP Strykers for backside support PLT Transportation
Medic: B TRP Medics, CASEVAC on site
CBRN Chamber
